definition: straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: A Buddhist temple stands proud in the middle of the city .
sentences.chinese: 一座佛寺傲然挺立在城市的中央。

sentences.english: Surely these rocks - virtually floating on air - cannot possibly stay standing?
sentences.chinese: 這些幾乎漂浮在空中的石頭肯定不可能保持挺立吧？

sentences.english: All around me the black fir-points stood upright and stock-still.
sentences.chinese: 我的周圍，黝黑的樅樹尖頂挺立着動也不動。

sentences.english: In summer, its bluish torso5) wears a delicate crown of snow and stands in the mist.
sentences.chinese: 夏季，黛青色的山體頂着精美的雪冠於雲霧中挺立。

sentences.english: Tiny floats along each stem are enough to hold it up.
sentences.chinese: 每節海藻莖周圍的微小浮力就足以使它傲然挺立。

sentences.english: It stood hardy and strong, and occasionally sprung a tender new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 它勇敢而堅強地挺立着，時而長出一片新的嫩葉。

sentences.english: Several pine trees stand erect on the hillside.
sentences.chinese: 幾棵青松挺立在山坡上。

sentences.english: Huge pine trees stand in solemnness, dark grey rocks are covered by moss.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的松樹在肅穆中挺立，蒼灰色的岩石上爬滿青苔。

sentences.english: The mud-brick walls of many buildings are still standing.
sentences.chinese: 許多建築的粘土磚仍然挺立着。

sentences.english: Garrosh Hellscream yells:Then we will stand astride this world as its masters.
sentences.chinese: 然後，我們將以這個世界主人的身份昂首挺立。

sentences.english: December is a friend Mei, pure and stand proudly.
sentences.chinese: 朋友是十二月的梅，純潔又傲然挺立。

sentences.english: So, the ultimate basis of humanity' standing is goodness.
sentences.chinese: 所以，人性挺立的最終根據在於人性本善。

sentences.english: Keep your posture straight and erect.
sentences.chinese: 保持你的姿態筆直挺立。

sentences.english: Life with her, stand proudly adamantine belief.
sentences.chinese: 生命傲然挺立，全以她堅定不移的信念。

sentences.english: “Upright” refers to the dog’s posture while he is working.
sentences.chinese: “挺立”指的是狗工作的時候的姿勢。
這是一頂傲然挺立的帽子。

definition: to stand for a long time
to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
perfectly straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright
(standing) very straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright/well-ironed/trim
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
